_header: Young men of Waterford learneth now to play
Note: Probably first stanza of longer poem
_description: Warning to the young men of Waterford — one 9-line stanza

BLLan418.First Lines:
Yung men of Waterford lernith now to pleiFor ȝur mere is
                    plowis i lad beth a wey…
BLLan418.Last Lines: …That of goth ȝur hedeNow hi walkith &c
BLLan418.Note:
Early seventeenth-century transcript from the missing part of London,  British Library Harley 913. Folio number reflects the most recent
                    foliation.
BLLan418.Attributed Title:
There is in this book a longe Discourse in meter, putting the youth of
                    Waterford in mind of harme taken by the Povers, and wishing them to beware for
                    þe time to come. I have written out þe first staffe only (f.
                    93)
